intro: Reseda decursiva var. propinqua, commonly known as narrowleaf reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
